intro: Sisymbrium glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth babylon wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with narrow, linear leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, typical of the family, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sisymbrium glabrescens is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
